item.title: Report E-2025010069
item.description:
Report E-2025010069

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was forked and released approximately 55-gallons to the dodck floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched crews from First Call Environmental (FCE) and Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. R+L deployed absorbents prior to their arrival. FCE utilized hand tools to collect the absorbents. All UN1210 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum, one (1) 55-gallon drum, and four (4) 95-gallon overpacks. TLE personnel aided in transferring all non-damaged product to new, undamaged pallets for continued shipment.

item.title: Report E-2025010038
item.description:
Report E-2025010038

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) cups of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the lid of the drum lifting up and leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010036
item.description:
Report E-2025010036

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a packaging defect that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. One (1) 85-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the 55-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120461
item.description:
Report E-2024120461

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-24
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 24, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3214 had faulty packaging during shipping and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all product from the trailer. All impacted waste and the damaged pail were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120465
item.description:
Report E-2024120465

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: MILAN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 16:34 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XEL) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 5 gallons of Armorflex (White) - (Hazardous - UN1866) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, 2 damaged drums, and oil-dri will be placed into 2 separate drums (a 65-gallon metal drum and a 65-gallon poly drum) and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release.

item.title: Report E-2024120464
item.description:
Report E-2024120464

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:45 PM ET, Michayla Lovitt with BCO contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Columbus, OH. The spill consists of approximately 1 cup of UNX LT Special Superior Heavy-Duty Detergent, which released from 1â€“50-pound paper bag due to a tear caused by rubbing against the trailer wall prior to arriving. The Contractor containerized the impacted bag and released product into (1) 55-gallon poly drum and staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024120437
item.description:
Report E-2024120437

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: PARMA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0651 ET, XPO-XCL notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Ammonium Hydrogendifluoride released from a plastic bag due to the bag ripping from underneath the pallet. The release impacted the concrete dock. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5lb release onto the concrete dock floor in a 2â€™x2â€™ area as a result of dunnage. The contract used a HEPA Vac to clean-up the release. The spill product, overpacked damaged bag, impacted PPE, and HEPA Vac filter were containerized into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated by the incident. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil was involved in this incident.
